                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	20. Every person whose consent to a marriage is required under section 19 is hereby authorized to prohibit the issue of the certificate by any Minister, at any time before the issue of the same, by notice in writing to such Minister, subscribed by the person so authorized with his or her name and place of abode and position with respect to either of the persons intending marriage, by reason of which he or she is so authorized as aforesaid.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Procedure on receipt of notice

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	21. If any such notice be received by such Minister, he shall not issue his certificate and shall not solemnize the said marriage until he has examined into the matter of the said prohibition, and is satisfied that the person prohibiting the marriage has no lawful authority for such prohibition,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	or until the said notice withdrawn by the person who gave it.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Issue of certificate in case of minority

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	22. When either of the persons intending marriage is a minor, and the Minister is not satisfied that the consent of the person whose consent to such marriage is required by section 19 has been obtained, such Minister shall not issue such certificate until the expiration of fourteen days after the receipt by him of the notice of marriage.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Issue of certificates to Native Christians

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	23. When any Native Christian about to be married takes a notice of Marriage to a Minister of Religion, or applies for a certificate from such Minister under section 17, such Minister shall, before issuing the certificate, ascertain whether such Native Christian is cognizant of the purport and effect of the said notice or certificate, as the case may be, and, if not, shall translate or caused to be translated the notice or certificate to such Native Christian into some language which he understands.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Form of certificate

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	24. The certificate to be issued by such Minister shall be in the form contained in the second schedule hereto annexed, or to the like effect.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Solemnization of Marriage 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	25. After the issue of the certificate by the Minister, marriage may be solemnized between the persons therein described according to such form or ceremony as the Minister thinks fit to adopt:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Provided that the marriage be solemnized in the presence of at least two witnesses besides the Minister.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Certificate void if marriage not solemnized within two months 


                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	26. Whenever a marriage is not solemnize within two months after the date of the certificate issued by such Minister as aforesaid, such certificate and all proceedings (if any) thereon shall be void, <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and no person shall proceed to solemnize the said marriage until new notice has been given and a certificate thereof issued in manner aforesaid.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-8.html">
                                    Part IV

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-8.html">


                                    REGISTRATION OF MARRIAGES SOLEMNIZED BY MINISTERS OF RELIGION

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Marriages when to be registered 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	27. All marriages hereafter solemnized in Bangladesh between persons one or both of whom professes or profess the Christian religion, except marriages solemnized under Part V or Part VI of this Act, shall be registered in manner hereinafter prescribed.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Registration of marriages solemnized by Clergymen of Church of England

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	28.  Every Clergyman of the Church of England shall keep a register of marriages and shall register therein, according to the tabular form set forth in the third schedule hereto annexed, every marriage which he solemnizes under this Act.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Quarterly returns to Archdeaconry

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	29. Every Clergyman of the Church of England shall send four times in every year returns in duplicate, authenticated by his signature, of the entries in the register of marriages solemnized at any place where he has any spiritual charge, to the Registrar of the Archdeaconry to which he is subject, or within the limits of which such place is situate.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
	Contents of returns

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	Such quarterly returns shall contain all the entries of marriages contained in the said register from the first day of January to the thirty-first day of March, from the first day of April to the thirtieth day of June, from the first day of July to the thirtieth day of September, and from the first day of October to the thirty-first day of December, of each year respectively, and shall be sent by such Clergyman within two weeks from the expiration of each of the quarters above specified.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	The said Registrar upon receiving the said returns shall send one copy thereof to the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Registration and returns of marriages solemnized by Clergymen of Church of Rome 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	30. 	Every marriage solemnized by a Clergyman of the Church of Rome shall be registered by the person and according to the form directed in that behalf by the Roman Catholic Bishop of the Diocese or Vicariate in which such marriage is solemnized,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and such person shall forward quarterly to the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages returns of the entries of all marriages registered by him during the three months next preceding.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Registration and returns of marriages solemnized by Clergymen of Church of Scotland

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	31. 	Every Clergyman of the Church of Scotland shall keep a register of marriages,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and shall register therein, according to the tabular form set forth in the third schedule hereto annexed, every marriage which he solemnizes under this Act,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and shall forward quarterly to the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages, through the Senior Chaplain of the Church of Scotland, returns, similar to those prescribed in section 29, of all such marriages.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Certain marriages to be registered in duplicate 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                         	32. Every marriage solemnized by any person who has received episcopal ordination, but who is not a Clergyman of the Church of England, or of the Church of Rome, or by any Minister of Religion licensed under this Act to solemnize marriages, shall, immediately after the solemnization thereof, be registered in duplicate by the person solemnizing the same; (that is to say) in a marriage-registrar-book to be kept by him for that purpose, according to the form contained in the fourth schedule hereto annexed, and also in a certificate attached to the marriage-register-book as a counterfoil.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Entries of such marriages to be signed and attested

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    33. The entry of such marriage in both the certificate and marriage-register-book shall be signed by the person solemnizing the marriage, and also by the persons married, and shall be attested by two credible witnesses, other than the person solemnizing the marriage, present at its solemnization.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Every such entry shall be made in order from the beginning to the end of the book, and the number of the certificate shall correspond with that of the entry in the marriage-register-book.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Certificate to be forwarded to Marriage Registrar, copied and sent to Registrar General

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	34. The person solemnizing the marriage shall forthwith separate the certificate from the marriage-register-book and send it, within one month from the time of the solemnization, to the Marriage Register of the district in which the marriage was solemnized, or, if there be more Marriage Registrars than one, to the Senior Marriage Registrar,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	who shall cause such certificate to be copied into a book to be kept by him for that purpose,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and shall send all the certificates which he has received during the month, with such number and signature or initials added thereto as are hereinafter required, to the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Copies of certificates to be entered and numbered

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	35. Such copies shall be entered in order from the beginning to the end of the said book, and shall bear both the number of the certificate as copied, and also a number to be entered by the Marriage Registrar, indicating the number of the entry of the said copy in the said book, according to the order in which he receives each certificate.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Registrar to add number of entry to certificate, and send to Registrar General

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	36. 	The Marriage Registrar shall also add such last-mentioned number of the entry of the copy in the book to the certificate, with his signature or initials, and shall, at the end of every month, send the same to the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Registration of marriages between Native Christians by persons referred to in clauses (1), (2) and (3) of section 5

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	37. 	When any marriage between Native Christians is solemnized by any such person, Clergyman or Minister of Religion as is referred to in clause (1), clause (2) or clause (3) of section 5, the person solemnizing the same shall, instead of proceeding in the manner provided by sections 28 to 36, both inclusive, register the marriage in a separate register-book, and shall keep it safely until it is filled, or, if he leave the district in which he solemnized the marriage before the said book is filled, shall make over the same to the person succeeding to his duties in the said district.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
	Custody and disposal of register-book


                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	Whoever has the control of the book at the time when it is filled, shall send it to the Marriage Registrar of the district, or, if there be more Marriage Registrars than one, to the Senior Marriage Registrar, who shall send it to the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages, to be kept by him with the records of his office.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-10.html">
                                    Part V

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-10.html">


                                    MARRIAGES SOLEMNIZED BY, OR IN THE PRESENCE OF, A MARRIAGE REGISTRAR

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Notice of intended marriage before Marriage Registrar

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	38. When a marriage is intended to be solemnized by, or in the presence of, a Marriage Registrar, one of the parties to such marriage shall give notice in writing, in the form contained in the first schedule hereto annexed, or to the like effect, to any Marriage Registrar of the District within which the parties have dwelt;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>    	or, if the parties dwell in different districts, shall give the like notice to a Marriage Registrar of each district,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and shall state therein the name and surname, and the profession or condition, of each of the parties intending marriage, the dwelling-place of each of them, the time during which each has dwelt therein, and the place at which the marriage is to be solemnized:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Provided that, if either party has dwelt in the place stated in the notice for more than one month, it may be stated therein that he or she has dwelt there one month and upwards.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Publication of notice

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	39. Every Marriage Registrar shall, on receiving any such notice, cause a copy thereof to be affixed in some conspicuous place in his office.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	When one of the parties intending marriage is a minor, every Marriage Registrar shall, within twenty-four hours after the receipt by him of the notice of such marriage, send, by post or otherwise, a copy of such notice to each of the other Marriage Registrars (if any) in the same district, who shall likewise affix the copy in some conspicuous place in his own office.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Notice to be filed and copy entered in Marriage Notice Book

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	40. The Marriage Registrar shall file all such notices and keep them with the records of his office,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and shall also forthwith enter a true copy of all such notices in a book to be furnished to him for that purpose by the Government and to be called the "Marriage Notice Book";<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and the Marriage Notice Book shall be open at all reasonable times, without fee, to all persons desirous of inspecting the same.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Certificate of notice given and oath made 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	41. If the party by whom the notice was given requests the Marriage Registrar to issue the certificate next hereinafter mentioned, and if one of the parties intending marriage has made oath as hereinafter required, the Marriage Registrar shall issue under his hand a certificate of such notice having been given and of such oath having been made:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Providedâ€“<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	that no lawful impediment be shown to his satisfaction why such certificate should not issue;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	that the issue of such certificate has not been forbidden, in manner hereinafter mentioned, by any person authorized in that behalf by this Act;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	that four days after the receipt of the notice have expired; and further,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	that where, by such oath, it appears that one of the parties intending marriage is a minor, fourteen days after the entry of such notice have expired.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Oath before issue of certificate

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	42. The certificate mentioned in section 41 shall not be issued by any Marriage Registrar, until one of the parties intending marriage appears personally before such Marriage Registrar, and makes oath-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) 	that he or she believes that there is not any impediment of kindred or affinity, or other lawful hindrance, to the said marriage, and <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b) 	that both the parties have, or (where they have dwelt in the districts of different Marriage Registrars) that the party making such oath has, had their, his or her usual place of abode within the district of such Marriage Registrar,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and, where either or each of the parties is a minor, â€“<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c) 	that the consent or consents to such marriage required by law has or have been obtained thereto, or that there is no person resident in Bangladesh authorized to give such consent, as the case may be.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	43. [Omitted by the Schedule of the Adaptation of Central Acts and Ordinances Order, 1949.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Consent of father or guardian

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	44. The provisions of section 19 apply to every marriage under this Part, either of the parties to which is a minor;

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
	Protest against issue of certificate

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	and any person whose consent to such marriage would be required thereunder may enter a protest against the issue of the Marriage Registrar's certificate, by writing, at any time before the issue of such certificate, the word "forbidden" opposite to the entry of the notice of such intended marriage in the Marriage Notice Book, and by subscribing thereto his or her name and place of abode, and his or her position with respect to either of the parties, by reason of which he or she is so authorized.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
	Effect of protest

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	When such protest has been entered, no certificate shall issue until the Marriage Registrar has examined into the matter of the protest, and is satisfied that it ought not to obstruct the issue of the certificate for the said marriage, or until the protest be withdrawn by the person who entered it.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Petition where person whose consent is necessary is insane, or unjustly withholds consent

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	45. If any person whose consent is necessary to any marriage under this Part is of unsound mind,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	or if any such person (other than the father) without just cause withholds his consent to the marriage,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	the parties intending marriage may apply by petition, to the District Judge:

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
	Procedure on petition

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	And the said District Judge may examine the allegations of the petition in a summary way:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	And, if upon examination such marriage appears proper, such District Judge shall declare the marriage to be a proper marriage.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Such declaration shall be as effectual as if the person whose consent was needed had consented to the marriage;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and, if he has forbidden the issue of the Marriage Registrar's certificate, such certificate shall be issued and the like proceedings may be had under this Part in relation to the marriage as if the issue of such certificate had not been forbidden.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Petition where Marriage Registrar refuses certificate. Procedure on petition

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	46. Whenever a Marriage Registrar refuses to issue a certificate under this Part, either of the parties intending marriage may apply by petition to the District Judge.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	The said District Judge may examine the allegations of the petition in a summary way, and shall decide thereon.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	The decision of such District Judge shall be final, and the Marriage Registrar to whom the application for the issue of a certificate was originally made shall proceed in accordance therewith. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	47. [Omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Petition when Registrar doubts authority of person forbidding

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	48. Whenever a Marriage Registrar, acting under the provisions of section 44, is not satisfied that the person for- bidding the issue of the certificate is authorized by law so to do, the said Marriage Registrar shall apply by petition, to the District Judge. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
	Procedure on petition

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	The said petition shall state all the circumstances of the case, and pray for the order and direction of the Court concerning the same,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and the said District Judge shall examine into the allegations of the petition and the circumstances of the case;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and if, upon such examination, it appears, that the person forbidding the issue of such certificate is not authorized by law so to do, such District Judge shall declare that the person forbidding the issue of such certificate is not authorized as aforesaid,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and thereupon such certificate shall be issued, and the like proceedings may be had in relation to such marriage as if the issue had not been forbidden.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	 <span class='footnote'  title='Paragraphs 6th, 7th and 8th of section 48 were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >7</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Liability for frivolous protest against issue of certificate 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	49. 	Every person entering a protest with the Marriage Registrar, under this Part, against the issue of any certificate, on grounds which such Marriage Registrar, under section 44 or the District Judge, under section 45 or 46, declares to be frivolous and such as ought not to obstruct the issue of the certificate, shall be liable for the costs of all proceedings in relation thereto and for damages, to be recovered by suit by the person against whose marriage such protest was entered.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Form of certificate

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	50. 	The certificate to be issued by the Marriage Registrar under the provisions of section 41 shall be in the form contained in the second schedule to this Act annexed or to the like effect,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and the Government shall furnish to every Marriage Registrar a sufficient number of forms of certificate.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Solemnization of marriage after issue of certificate

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	51. 	After the issue of the certificate of the Marriage Registrar, <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	or, where notice is required to be given under this Act to the Marriage Registrars for different districts, after the issue of the certificates of the Marriage Registrars for such districts,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>marriage may, if there be no lawful impediment to the marriage of the parties described in such certificate or certificates, be solemnized between them, according to such form and ceremony as they think fit to adopt.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	But every such marriage shall be solemnized in the presence of some Marriage Registrar (to whom shall be delivered such certificate or certificates as aforesaid), and of two or more credible witnesses besides the Marriage Registrar.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	And in some part of the ceremony each of the parties shall declare as follows, or to the like effect:-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	"I do solemnly declare that I know not of any lawful impediment why I, A. B., may not be joined in matrimony to C. D."<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	And each of the parties shall say to the other as follows or to the like effect:â€“ "I call upon these persons here present to witness that I, A. B., do take thee, C. D., to be my lawful wedded wife [or husband]."

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	When marriage not had within two months after notice, new notice required

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	52. 	Whenever a marriage is not solemnized within two months after the copy of the notice has been entered by the Marriage Registrar, as required by section 40, the notice and the certificate, if any, issued thereupon, and all other proceedings thereupon, shall be void;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and no person shall proceed to solemnize the marriage, nor shall any Marriage Registrar enter the same, until new notice has been given, and entry made, and certificate thereof given, at the time and in the manner aforesaid.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Marriage Registrar may ask for particulars to be registered

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	53. 	A Marriage Registrar before whom any marriage is solemnized under this Part may ask of the person to be married the several particulars required to be registered touching such marriage.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Registration of marriage solemnized under Part V

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	54. 	After the solemnization of any marriage under this Part, the Marriage Registrar present at such solemnization shall forthwith register the marriage in duplicate; that is to say, in a marriage-register-book, according to the form of the fourth schedule hereto annexed, and also in a certificate attached to the marriage-register-book as a counterfoil.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	The entry of such marriage in both the certificate and the marriage-register-book shall be signed by the person by or before whom the marriage has been solemnized, if there be any such person, and by the Marriage Registrar present at such marriage, whether or not it is solemnized by him, and also by the parties married, and attested by two credible witnesses other than the Marriage Registrar and person solemnizing the marriage.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Every such entry shall be made in order from the beginning to the end of the book, and the number of the certificate shall correspond with that of the entry in the marriage register-book.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Certificates to be sent monthly to Registrar General. 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	55. 	The Marriage Registrar shall forthwith separate the certificate from the marriage-register-book and send it, at the end of every month, to the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                             Custody of register-book

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	The Marriage Registrar shall keep safely the said register-book until it is filled, and shall then send it to the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages, to be kept by him with the records of his office.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	56.	[Omitted by the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973), section 3 and 2nd Schedule.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Registrars to ascertain that notice and certificate are understood by Native Christians

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	57. 	When any Native Christian about to be married gives a notice of marriage, or applies for a certificate from a Marriage Registrar, such Marriage Registrar shall ascertain whether the said Native Christian understands the English language, and, if he does not, the Marriage Registrar shall translate, or cause to be translated, such notice or certificate, or both of them, as the case may be, to such Native Christian into a language which he understands; <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	or the Marriage Registrar shall otherwise ascertain whether the Native Christian is cognizant of the purport and effect of the said notice and certificate.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Native Christians to be made to understand declarations

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	58.
