When any Native Christian is married under the provisions of this Part, the person solemnizing the marriage shall ascertain whether such Native Christian understands the English language, and, if he does not, the person solemnizing the marriage shall, at the time of the solemnization, translate, or cause to be translated, to such Native Christian, into a language which he understands, the declarations made at such marriage in accordance with the provisions of this Act.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Registration of marriages between Native Christians

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    59. The registration of marriages between Native Christians under this Part shall be made in conformity with the rules laid down in section 37 (so far as they are applicable), and not otherwise.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-11.html">
                                    Part VI

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-11.html">


                                    MARRIAGE OF NATIVE CHRISTIANS

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	On what conditions marriages of Native Christians may be certified

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	60.  Every marriage between Native Christians applying for a certificate shall, without the preliminary notice required under Part III, be certified under this Part, if the following conditions be fulfilled, and not otherwise:â€“ <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1)	the age of the man intending to be married shall exceed sixteen years, and the age of the woman intending to be married shall exceed thirteen years;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)	neither of the persons intending to be married shall have a wife or husband still living;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3)	in the presence of a person licensed under section 9, and of at least two credible witnesses other than such person, each of the parties shall say to the other â€“<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"I call upon these persons here present to witness that I, A. B., in the presence of Almighty God, and in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, do take thee, C. D., to be my lawful wedded wife [or husband]" or words to the like effect:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Provided that no marriage shall be certified under this Part when either of the parties intending to be married has not completed his or her eighteenth year, unless such consent as is mentioned in section 19 has been given to the intended marriage, or unless it appears that there is no person living authorized to give such consent.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Grant of certificate

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	61. When, in respect to any marriage solemnized under this Part, the conditions prescribed in section 60 have been fulfiled, the person licensed as aforesaid, in whose presence the said declaration has been made, shall, on the application of either of the parties to such marriage, and on the payment of a fee of four annas, grant a certificate of the marriage.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	The certificate shall be signed by such licensed person, and shall be received in any suit touching the validity of such marriage as conclusive proof of its having been performed.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Keeping of register-book and deposit of extracts therefrom with Registrar General

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	62. (1) Every person licensed under section 9 shall keep in English, or in the   <span class='footnote'  title='The words "Bangla language" were substituted, for the words "Vernacular language in ordinary use in the district or State in which the marriage was solemnized" by section 3 and 2nd schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >8</a></sup></span></span>[Bangla language], and in such form as the Government, by which he was licensed may from time to time prescribe,  a register-book of all marriages solemnized under this Part in his presence, and shall deposit in the office of the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages for the territories under the administration of the said Government in such form and at such intervals as that Government may prescribe, true and duly authenticated extracts form his register-book of all entries made therein since the last of those intervals.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	 <span class='footnote'  title='Sub-section (2) of section 62 was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >9</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]      

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Searches in register-book and copies of entries

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	63. Every person licensed under this Act to grant certificates of marriage, and keeping a marriage-register-book under section 62, shall, at all reasonable times, allow search to be made in such book, and shall, on payment of the proper fee, give a copy, certified under his hand, of an entry therein.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Books in which marriages of Native Christians under Part I or Part III are registered

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	64. The provisions of sections 62 and 63, as to form of the register-book, depositing extracts therefrom, allowing searches thereof, and giving copies of the entries therein, shall, mutatis mutandis, apply to the books kept under section 37.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Part VI not to apply to Roman Catholics
	Saving of certain marriages


                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	65. This Part of this Act, except so much of sections 62 and 63 as are referred to in section 64, shall not apply to marriages between Roman Catholics. But nothing herein contained shall invalidate any marriage celebrated between Roman Catholics under the provisions of Part V of Act No. XXV of 1864, previous to the twenty-third day of February, 1865.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-12.html">
                                    Part VII

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-12.html">


                                    PENALTIES

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	False oath, declaration, notice or certificate for procuring marriage

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    66. Whoever, for the purpose of procuring a marriage or license of marriage, intentionally,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	where an oath or declaration is required by this Act, or by any rule or custom of a Church according to the rites and ceremonies of which a marriage is intended to be solemnized, such Church being the Church of England or of Scotland or of Rome, makes a false oath or declaration, or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	where a notice or certificate is required by this Act, signs a false notice or certificate,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>shall be deemed to have committed the offence punishable under section 193 of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "Penal Code" were substituted, for the words "Pakistan Penal Code" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >10</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code] with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years and, at the discretion of the Court, with fine.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Forbidding, by false personation, issue of certificate by Marriage Registrar

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	67. Whoever forbids the issue, by a Marriage Registrar, of a certificate, by falsely representing himself to be a person whose consent to the marriage is required by law, knowing or believing such representation to be false, or not having reason to believe it to be true, shall be deemed guilty of the offence described in section 205 of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "Penal Code" were substituted, for the words "Pakistan Penal Code" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >11</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code].

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Solemnizing marriage without due authority

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	68. Whoever, not being authorized by section 5 of this Act to solemnize marriages, solemnizes or professes to solemnize in the absence of a Marriage Registrar of the district in which the ceremony takes place, a marriage between persons one or both of whom is or are a Christian or Christians, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to ten years, or (in lieu of a sentence of imprisonment for seven years or upwards) with transportation for a term of not less than seven years, and not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Solemnizing marriage out of proper time, or without witnesses

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	69. Whoever knowingly and wilfuly solemnizes a marriage between persons one or both of whom is or are a Christian or Christians, at any time other than between the hours of six in the morning  and  seven  in  the  evening, or in the absence of at least<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>two credible witnesses other than the person solemnizing the marriage, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
	Saving of marriages solemnized under special license

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	This section does not apply to marriages solemnized under special licenses granted by the Anglican Bishop of Diocese or by his Commissary, not to marriages performed between the hours of seven in the evening and six in the morning by a Clergyman of the Church of Rome, when he has received the general or special license in that behalf mentioned in section 10.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Nor does this section apply to marriages solemnized by a Clergyman of the Church of Scotland according to the rules, rites, ceremonies and customs of the Church of Scotland.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Solemnizing without notice or within fourteen days after notice, marriage with minor

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	70. Any Minister of Religion licensed to solemnize marriages under this Act, who, without a notice in writing, or, when one of the parties to the marriage is a minor, and the required consent of the parents or guardians to such marriage has not been obtained, within fourteen days after the receipt by him of notice of such marriage, knowingly and wilfully solemnizes a marriage under Part III, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Issuing certificate, or marrying without publication of notice; marrying after expiry of notice; 
	
	solemnizing marriage with minor within fourteen days without authority of Court, or without sending copy of notice; 
    	
	issuing cert

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	71. 	A Marriage Registrar under this Act, who commits any of the following offences:â€“<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1)	knowingly and wilfuly issues any certificate for marriage, or solemnizes any marriage, without publishing the notice of such marriage as directed by this Act;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)	after the expiration of two months after the copy of the notice has been entered as required by section 40 in respect of any marriage, solemnizes such marriage; <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3)	solemnizes, without any order of a competent Court authorizing him to do so, any marriage, when one of the parties is a minor, before the expiration of fourteen days after the receipt of the notice of such marriage, or without sending, by the post or otherwise, a copy of such notice to the Senior Marriage Registrar of the district if there be more Marriage Registrars of the district than one, and if he himself be not the Senior Marriage Registrar;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4)	issues any certificate the issue of which has been prohibited, as in this Act provided, by any person authorized to prohibit the issue thereof,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Issuing certificate after expiry of notice, or, in case of minor, within fourteen days after notice, or against authorized prohibition

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	72. Any Marriage Registrar knowingly and wilfuly issuing any certificate for marriage after the expiration of two months after the notice has been entered by him as aforesaid, <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	or knowingly and wilfuly issuing, without the order of a competent Court authorizing him so to do, any certificate for marriage, where one of the parties intending marriage is a minor, before the expiration of fourteen days after the entry of such notice, or any certificate the issue of which has been forbidden as aforesaid by any person authorized in this behalf,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>shall be deemed to have committed an offence under section 166 of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "Penal Code" were substituted, for the words "Pakistan Penal Code" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >12</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code].

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Persons authorized to solemnize marriage (other than Clergy of Churches of England, Scotland or Rome); 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	73. Whoever, being authorized under this Act to solemnize a marriage,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and not being a Clergyman of the Church of England, solemnizing a marriage after due publication of banns, or under a license from the Anglican Bishop of the Diocese or a Surrogate duly authorized in that behalf,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	or, not being a Clergyman of the Church of Scotland, solemnizing a marriage according to the rules, rites, ceremonies and customs of that church,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	or, not being a Clergyman of the Church of Rome, solemnizing a marriage according to the rites, rules, ceremonies and customs of that church,

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
	issuing certificate or marrying, without publishing 	notice, or after expiry of certificate;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	knowingly and wilfully issues any certificate for marriage under this Act, or solemnizes any marriage between such persons as aforesaid, without publishing, or causing to be affixed, the notice of such marriage as directed in Part III of this Act, or after the expiration of two months after the certificate has been issued by him;

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
	issuing certificate for, or solemnizing, marriage with minor, within fourteen days after notice;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	or knowingly and wilfully issues any certificate for  marriage, or solemnizes a marriage between such persons when one of the persons intending marriage is a minor, before the expiration of fourteen days after the receipt of notice of such marriage, or without sending, by the post or otherwise, a copy of such notice to the Marriage Registrar, or, if there be more Marriage Registrars than one, to the Senior Marriage Registrar of the district;

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
    	issuing certificate authorizedly forbidden;  

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	or knowingly and wilfully issues any certificate the issue of which has been forbidden, under this Act, by any person authorized to forbid the issue;

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
    	solemnizing marriage authorizedly forbidden

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	or knowingly and wilfully solemnizes any marriage forbidden by any person authorized to forbid the same;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to four years, and shall also be liable to fine.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Unlicensed person granting certificate pretending to be licensed

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	74. Whoever, not being licensed to grant a certificate of marriage under Part VI of this Act, grants such certificate intending thereby to make it appear that he is so licensed, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Whoever, being licensed to grant certificates of marriage under Part VI of this Act, without just cause refuses, or wilfully neglects or omits, to perform any of the duties imposed upon him by that Part shall be punished with fine which may extend to one hundred taka.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Destroying or falsifying register-books

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	75. Whoever, by himself or another, wilfully destroys or injures any register-book or the counterfoil certificates thereof, or any part thereof, or any authenticated extract therefrom, <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	or falsely makes or counterfeits any part of such register-book or counterfoil certificates,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	or wilfully inserts any false entry in any such register-book or counterfoil certificate or authenticated extract,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Limitation of prosecutions under Act



                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	76. The prosecution for every offence punishable under this Act shall be commenced within two years after the offence is committed.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-13.html">
                                    Part VIII

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-13.html">


                                    MISCELLANEOUS

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	What matters need not be proved in respect of marriage in accordance with Act

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	77. Whenever any marriage has been solemnized in accordance with the provisions of sections 4 and 5, it shall not be void merely on account of any irregularity in respect of any of the following matters, namely:â€“<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1)	any statement made in regard to the dwelling of the persons married, or to the consent of any person whose consent to such marriage is required by law:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)	the notice of the marriage:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3)	the certificate or translation thereof:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4)	the time and place at which the marriage has been solemnized:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5)	the registration of the marriage.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Correction of errors

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	78. Every person charged with the duty of registering any marriage, who discovers any error in the form or substance of any such entry, may, within one month next after the discovery of such error, in the presence of the persons married, or, in case of their death or absence, in the presence of two other credible witnesses, correct the error, by entry in the margin, without any alteration of the original entry, and shall sign the marginal entry, and add thereto the date of such correction, and such person shall make the like marginal entry in the certificate thereof.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	And every entry made under this section shall be attested by the witnesses in whose presence it was made.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	And in case such certificate has been already sent to the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages, such person shall make and send in like manner a separate certificate of the original erroneous entry, and of the marginal correction therein made.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Searches and copies of entries

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	79. Every person solemnizing a marriage under this Act, and hereby required to register the same,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and every Marriage Registrar or Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages having the custody for the time being of any register of marriages, or of any certificate, or duplicate or copies of certificate, under this Act,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	shall, on payment of proper fees, at all reasonable times allow searches to be made in such register, or for such certificate, or duplicate, or copies, and give a copy under his hand of any entry in the same.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Certified copy of entry in marriage-register, etc., to be evidence

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	80. Every certified copy, purporting to be signed by the person entrusted under this Act with the custody of any marriage register or certificate, or duplicate, required to be kept or delivered under this Act, of an entry of a marriage in such register, or of any such certificate or duplicate, shall be received as evidence of the marriage purporting to be so entered, or of the facts purporting to be so certified therein, without further proof of such register or certificate, or duplicate, or of any entry therein, respectively, or of such copy.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Certificates of certain marriages for Government

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    81. The Registrar General of Births, Deaths, and Marriages  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "and the officers appointed under section 56" were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >13</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] shall, at the end of every quarter in each year, select, from the certificates of marriages forwarded to  <span class='footnote'  title='The word "Him" was substituted, for the words "them respectively" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >14</a></sup></span></span>[Him], during such quarter, the certificates of the marriages of which the Government  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "and the officers appointed under section 56" were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >15</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] may desire that evidence shall be transmitted to England, and shall send the same certificates, signed by   <span class='footnote'  title='The word "Him" was substituted, for the words "them respectively" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >16</a></sup></span></span>[Him] to the Government.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Government to prescribe fees

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	82. Fees shall be chargeable under this Act for-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	receiving and publishing notices of marriages;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>issuing certificates for marriage by Marriage Registrars,        and registering marriages by the same;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>entering protests against, or prohibitions of, the issue of         certificates for marriage by the said Registrars; <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>searching register-books or certificates, or duplicates of         copies thereof;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	giving copies of entries in the same under section 63 and 79.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	The Government shall fix the amount of such fees respectively,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	and may from time to time vary or remit them either generally or in special cases, as to it may seem fit.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

<script>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

                skin: null,
                throttle: 250,

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }


    /*    $(document).ready(function(){
            loopcounter('first-counter');
            loopcounter('second-counter');
        });*/
</script>

<a target="_blank" href="/act-print-27.html" class="pull-right no-print" style="width: 72px;height: 80px;margin-right: -40px;
margin-bottom: 7px;"> <img src="/resources/website/assets/img/printer.jpg" style="margin: 15px;width: 80px"/>

    
        
        
            <p class="pull-right"  style="margin-right: -40px;
margin-bottom: 7px;color:#FF3399;">Print View</p>

<div class="col-md-11 boxed-layout " style="padding: 10px;width: 97%">
    <section class="bg-act-section padding-bottom-20">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <div class="text-center">
                    <h3>

                        <span class='footnote'   title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words "Bangladesh" and "Government" were substituted, for the words "Pakistan" and "Provincial Government" or "Central Government" respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'>1</sup></span></span>The Christian Marriage Act, 1872  

                        
                        
                    </h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            <h4 style="color: #fff;"> (
                                
                                    
                                    
                                        
                                            
                                            ACT
                                        
                                        NO. XV OF 1872
                                    
                                

                                )
                            </h4>
                        
                    
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="bt-act-section-search ">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-bottom12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <p class="pull-left no-print">
                    <a href="#" onclick="window.history.back();return false;"><i class="fa fa-arrow-left" title="Back"
                                                                                 aria-hidden="true"></i></a></p>
                <p class="pull-right print-center publish-date">
                    [ 18th July, 1872   ]
                </p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    
    <section
            class="padding-bottom-20 ">
        <div class="row margin-top-20 ">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12 lineremove">
                <button class="printIco print-only pull-right" onclick="window.print();return false;"
                        style="width: 72px;height: 80px;"><i
                        class="fa fa-print" style="font-size: 40px;"></i></button>
                
                    

                        <div class="row">
                            <div class="col-md-2"></div>
                            <div class="col-md-10 text-center act-role-style">
                                
                                <strong>
                                    <span class='footnote' href='#' title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words "Bangladesh" and "Government" were substituted, for the words "Pakistan" and "Provincial Government" or "Central Government" respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>â™£An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to the solemnization of the marriages of Christians.

                                    
                                    
                                </strong>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="row">
                            
                            
                            
                                <div class="col-md-2">&nbsp;&nbsp;Preamble</div>
                            

                            <div class="col-md-10">

                                
                                <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>   WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to the solemnization of the marriages of persons professing the Christian religion; It is hereby enacted as follows:-  <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>  <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

                                
                                
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    
                    
                    
                
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="padding-bottom-20 bg-striped ">
        
        
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                PRELIMINARY

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Short title 
  	Extent

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	1. This Act may be called the <a title='Christian Marriage Act, 1872' href='/act-27.html'>Christian Marriage Act, 1872</a>.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	It extends to the whole of Bangladesh and, so far only as regards Christian citizens of Bangladesh,  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "to the Acceding States" omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >3</a></sup></span></span>[* * *].

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Repealed] 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	2. [Repealed by the Repealing Act, 1938 (Act No. I of 1938), section 2 and Schedule.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Interpretation-clause 


                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	3. In this Act, unless there is something repugnant in the subject or context,-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"Church of England" and "Anglican" mean and apply to the Church of England as by law established;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"Church of Scotland" means the Church of Scotland as by law established;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"Church of Rome" and "Roman Catholic" mean and apply to the Church which regards the Pope of Rome as its spiritual head;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"Church" includes any chapel or other building generally used for public Christian worship;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"minor" means a person who has not completed the age of twenty-one years and who is not a widower or a widow;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>the expression "Christians" means persons professing the Christian religion;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and the expression "Native Christians" includes the Christian descendants of  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "inhabitants of Indo-Bangla Pakistan" were substituted, for the words "Natives of Indo-Pakistan" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >4</a></sup></span></span>[inhabitants of Indo-Bangla Pakistan] sub-continent converted to Christianity, as well as such converts; <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages" means a Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages appointed under the <a title='Births, Deaths and Marriages Registration Act, 1886' href='/act-56.html'>Births, Deaths and Marriages Registration Act, 1886</a>.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-5.html">
                                    à¦­à¦¾à¦— à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® I

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-27/part-5.html">


                                    THE PERSONS BY WHOM MARRIAGES MAY BE SOLEMNIZED

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
